p: As aforementioned, cytoskeletal structure rearrangement grant various cellular functions in various cell linages, such as: podosome patterning in osteoclasts and EMT transition. This has led to a surge in the efforts for identification of safer and more effective compounds which can modulate these cellular behaviors. Plectranthoic acid (PA), a natural compound isolated from the extracts of Ficus microcarpa, has been reported to possess the capability to induce cell cycle arrest and apoptosis in prostate cancer cells [ 61, 62]. Recently, Akhtar et al. [ 61] extensively studied the PA biological effects on suppressing the cellular migration. Through the proteomic analysis, authors identified that Rac1 is the major cadherin signaling protein modulated with PA treatment.
